document.masterDocTitle: Mites of the subgenus Microtimyobia (Acariformes: Myobiidae: Radfordia) and their host-parasite relationships with cricetid rodents (Cricetidae) 2954

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Mites of the subgenus Microtimyobia (Acariformes: Myobiidae: Radfordia) and their host-parasite relationships with cricetid rodents (Cricetidae) 2954

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. FEMALE ( Figs. 14 , 16 ). Subcapitular setae m with 2 tines. Setae vi distinctly wider than e2 . Setae e1 and f1 narrow lanceolate. Distances c1-d1 and d1-d2 subequal. Vulvar region distinctly ornamented. Setae ps3 distinctly developed, slightly curved. Setae ag2 at least twice longer than ag1 . Setae 1b and 1d distinctly thickened, about 2 times thicker and longer than 1a . Setae 2a and 3a whip-like, much longer than 2b . Trochanter I without ventral projection, covered ventrally by tubercles. Measurements ( 7 paratypes ): body, including gnathosoma, 330– 420 long, 195–230 maximum wide. Lengths of setae: vi 45–50, ve 80–90, si 100–125, se 65–80, c1 55–60, c2 60– 70, d1 55–60, d2 60–65, e1 and f1 24–27,
e2 35
–47, 2a 78–85, 3a 80–90, 4a 30–45.

MALE ( Figs. 15 , 16 ). Subcapitular setae m membranous lanceolate. Genital cone slightly elongated, length/ width ratio 1.5–1.7:1, with straight lateral margins. Bases of setae vi situated anterior to setae ps2 . Setae f1 1.3–1.4 times shorter than e2 . Posterior end of opisthosoma with tubercles. Setae 2a whip-like, much longer than 2b . Trochanter I without ventral projection, covered by tubercles. Measurements of holotype : body, including gnathosoma, 300 long, 175 maximum wide. Aedeagus 135 long. Lengths of setae: vi 15, ve 70, si 22, se 78, c2 80, e1 65,
e2 30
, f1 22, 2a 76, 3a 70, 4a 30.
FEMALE TRITONYMPH ( Fig. 17 ). Setae f2 and h2 stick-like, other dorsal idiosomal setae narrow lanceolate. Setae 3a and 4a highly variable in lenght, 10–120 long. Tarsus IV with 4 setae.

Type host and locality.
Alticola argentatus
from Kirghizia ( Bochkov 1995 ).

Hosts and distribution. This species is known from voles of the genus
Alticola
. Dusbabek & Daniel (1975) recorded
R. lemnina
from
Alticola roylei
from Nepal , however, based on measurements provided in their work these mites should be referred to
R. alticolae
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 14.
Radfordia (M.) alticolae Bochkov, 1995
from
Alticola argentatus
, female. A, dorsal view; B, ventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Alticola strelzowi
(new host) from Russia ( Tuva ) and Kazakhstan ;

Alticola roylei
from Nepal ( Dusbabek & Daniel 1975 ).

Material examined .
Alticola argentatus
—male holotype ( ZISP T-My-3),
1 male and 7 female paratypes ,
KIRGHIZIA
: near Chatyr-Kul’ Lake ,
18 July 1990
, coll. A. Bochkov
;
1 male paratype ,
KIRGHIZIA
: Bormoldoy Mountain ridge,
22 August 1992
, coll. P. Chirov
; 9 males , 15 females , 6 female TN (1 pharate), and
2 male TN ( AVB 09-1201 - 011 ),
KIRGHIZIA
: Kirghizskiy Mountain Ridge , Sukhuluk ,
17 September 1998
, coll. A. Stekolnikov
;
8 female TN (1 pharate) ( AVB 09-1201 - 010 ),
KIRGHIZIA
: Kirghizskiy Mountain Ridge, Ala- Archa ,
11 September 1998
, coll. A. Stekolnikov.

12 September 2009
, coll. A. Abramov.

18 August 2009
, coll. A. Abramov (AA #219)

RUSSIA

21 August 2009
, coll. A. Abramov (AA #270); 1 pharate female TN and

Alticola semicanus
— 2 males , 2 females , 2 female TN, and
1 male TN ( AVB 08-1809 - 003 ) ( ZISP 76778 ),
RUSSIA

Type deposition.
Radfordia alticolae
—ZISP, female holotype (T-My-3) (examined).
